name: Confirm-to-Execute
description: Guardrails requiring explicit confirmation before the assistant changes schedules or sends communications.

prd.problemStatement: Automated actions can have significant impacts on operations. Users need confidence that the system won't make changes or send communications without explicit approval to prevent errors and maintain control.
goals: Require explicit confirmation for all impactful actions
Provide clear preview of what will change before execution
Enable quick approval for trusted routine actions
userStories: As a superintendent, I want to confirm before schedules change so that I prevent unintended modifications
As a superintendent, I want to preview what will happen before approving so that I understand the impact
As a superintendent, I want quick approval for routine actions so that confirmations don't slow me down
As an admin, I want all confirmations logged so that I can audit decisions
dependencies: Scheduling and communications systems must be built
